title: can no longer send out an e-mail
content:
I can no longer receive nor send out e-mail messages on my desktop. Note - I can receive and send out messages on my phone.

So on my desktop, I get this warning message now after earlier today changing a password in Spectrum which is required to be longer than my former password for the old roadrunner wi.rr.com

Sending of message failed. see more in attached .jpg

I have no idea what to do.
creator: zbadger

title: Shortcut to creating filter
content:
I have recently lost all my filters after a conversion to IMAP. To quickly generate many new filters, I wish to have a quick shortcut, perhaps a key-combination, that will do the following:

For the message that is currently highlighted and for which the shortcut is invoked:

Create a filter that will Match on From > Contains > the domain name in the URL

and that will Move the message to Local Folders > Trash

Is there such a way to do this?

Thank you

Michael
creator: RadFirefox

title: edit menu
content: Where is the edit menu? There is no way to copy, paste, cut. Even "Edit as a new message" has disappeared.

title: "Search messages" now blank number of hits after 1s - why? Came with last update
content:
Using v128.14.0esr 32-bit

Number of hits searching a folder always stood there permanently after a search. - either text "no matches found" or number of matches is blanked after 1s

Why?

This came with last update just a couple of days ago, with new reminders to donate and stuff.

Regards

title: Сообщение Ваш браузер устарел
content: Пытаюсь добавить второй ящик в Mozilla Thunderbird, появляется такое сообщение, см. скрин. Как исправить?
creator: abykoff

title: Thunderbird subfolder locked
content: Hello, in my Thunderbird the main subfolder, which used to contain my email Inbox, Outbox, Draft, Junk and Trash menus, suddenly appears with a small lock and no longer shows the Outbox (all outgoing emails) and Draft options. It also won^t let me create any new Outbox subfolder. So I currently cannot see any of my recently send emails, while all older emails send out, that were archived in the local folder, are still visible/accessible. When searching in the Troubleshoot Information menu I cannot find the “Open Folder” feature - so I don’t know how to fix the problem through trouble shooting. Please advise and what to do. Thank you.
creator: tgorr

title: Unsubscribing from IMAP folders doesn't work
content: I uncheck folders in "Subscribe", press OK. Then open "Subscribe" again. And those folders are checked again. And this happens only with one mail provider. For other mail providers unsubscribing works.
creator: utmuk

title: Hello - I cannot access Mozilla email page, it stays blank   It just says Mozille not responding.
content: For the past two day, my email page is blank with just the message "Mozilla Thunderbird not responding." I can get optus webmail but the Mozilla page has my whole life in it! Many thank, Judith
creator: deboertj

title: Annoying message from disabled account
content:
Hi to all.

I've had one of my TB configured email accounts disabled so I cannot login to it. How can I avoid TB to show me again and again that it's not able to connect that account? I just want to keep the already received/sent emails there in TB but it goes on and on showing that message even if I don't work on that account via TB anymore.

I've tried to unflag the option to check new messages from the Server options, but it didn't work. I've also tried to move all the emails/folder on local folders via TB interface, but this was made just partially possible because TB tried to login possibly due to some still-not-downloaded old messages which where made impossible to move. Moving all to a local folder will let me delete the account from TB and set me free from that annoying message which is also causing TB to be resource consuming, I don't know why, so that the laptop fan goes crazy (in such case, quitting TB causes the laptop fan to be back in peace in seconds).

Thanks. Regards.
creator: manolo.didomenico

title: Thunderbird error "User Already Soecified"
content:
Hi Out of the blue, I am now seeing this error message when trying to open Thunderbird on my laptop. As far as I know, nothing has changed, I'm using v140.30esr and have made no other changes. Weirdly email works OK on my iPhone using their Zoho email app.

I've tried disabling add-ons in Thunderbird, switching off MacAfee Firewall but it makes no difference.

Is there some reset you can perform please?

Thanks Jon
creator: jon.bygate

title: Cannot receive messages
content: Dear Sir/Madam, After the last Thunderbird update I am not able to receive mails. I was wondering if some maintenance is going on in your servers. Regards, Stefano
